Plugins - Additions

Plugins in this category add to the calculator context.

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_additions.AddCisFunction

Calculator plugin to add the cis function. cis(x) is equivalent to cos(x)+I*sin(x)

Calculator >>> 2*cis(pi/3)
1 + √3⋅ⅈ

Initializes the plugin

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the plugin

  • priority (int) – The priority of the plugin. Lower numbers designate that a plugin should be run before others

cis(*args, **kwargs)

Implements the mathematical cis function. Available in the calculator context. All parameters are passed to sympy.sin() and sympy.cos() functions

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_additions.AddExternalLinks

Calculator plugin to add external links to Desmos, Symbolab, Wolfram|Alpha and SymPy Gamma

Initializes the plugin

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the plugin

  • priority (int) – The priority of the plugin. Lower numbers designate that a plugin should be run before others

desmos()

Opens the Desmos graphing calculator in the browser. Available in the calculator context

Return type

None

symbolab()

Opens Symbolab in the browser. Available in the calculator context

Return type

None

sympygamma()

Opens SymPy Gamma in the browser. Available in the calculator context

Return type

None

wolframalpha()

Opens Wolfram|Alpha in the browser. Available in the calculator context

Return type

None

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_additions.AddFactorDB

Adds the API for FactorDB, a website that provides factors for numbers.

Calculator >>> factordb(29928893193015398318666605389344864349536211)
FactorDBResponse(29928893193015398318666605389344864349536211 is composite, fully factored)
    Factors: {3: 1, 11: 1, 648181: 1, 1399202008951362319095335248405636807: 1}

The response object contains the number n queried, the status response, and factors as a dict

Initializes the plugin

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the plugin

  • priority (int) – The priority of the plugin. Lower numbers designate that a plugin should be run before others

factordb(n)

Get the response from FactorDB

Parameters

n (int | str) – The number to query

Returns

The response from FactorDB

Return type

AddFactorDB.FactorDBResponse

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_additions.AddNewtonsMethod

Calculator plugin to add the single variable Newton’s method

Calculator >>> newton(x*(x**2-1), 2, x, 2)
8192
────
7117

Initializes the plugin

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the plugin

  • priority (int) – The priority of the plugin. Lower numbers designate that a plugin should be run before others

newton(f, x0, x=None, i=1)

Implements single variable Newton’s methodAvailable in the Calculator context.

Parameters

  • f (sympy.core.Expr) – The expression to perform Newton’s method on

  • x0 (int) – The initial guess for the root

  • x (sympy.core.symbol.Symbol) – The independent variable x, defaults to x

  • i (int) – The amount of times to iterate

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_additions.AddOriginVectors

Calculator plugin to add the origin vectors to the calculator context. o<n> is the origin vector in R^n

Calculator >>> o3
⎡0⎤
⎢ ⎥
⎢0⎥
⎢ ⎥
⎣0⎦

Initializes the plugin

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the plugin

  • priority (int) – The priority of the plugin. Lower numbers designate that a plugin should be run before others

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_additions.AddnIntegrate

Calculator plugin to add numerical integration. nintegrate(x) is equivalent to Integral(x).evalf()

Initializes the plugin

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the plugin

  • priority (int) – The priority of the plugin. Lower numbers designate that a plugin should be run before others

nintegrate(*args, **kwargs)

Implements the numerical integration. Available in the Calculator context.
